sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"附加物，增加物"之意。
means: attachment ：指用于扩大原物用途的附件。
supplement ：主要指使书、报等正广更完善而额外增加的部分。
accessory ：作"附件"解时，与attachment同义，可互换，但还指增加美观的附属品。

sentence.Network_en: She also writes a regular column for the Times Educational Supplement.
sentence.Network_cn: 她也定期为《泰晤士报高等教育增刊》写专栏文章。

sentence.Network_en: Soldiers in both countries supplement their incomes with payoffs from drugs exporters.
sentence.Network_cn: 两国士兵都用毒品走私贩的贿赂来贴补收入。

sentence.Network_en: Some people may be entitled to a housing benefit supplement.
sentence.Network_cn: 有些人可能有资格拿到住房补贴。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin supplementum, from supplere 'fill up, complete' (see supply)

entry.def: If you supplement something, you add something to it in order to improve it.

example.ex: ...people doing extra jobs outside their regular jobs to supplement their incomes...
example.tran: 除了正常的工作外还要额外兼职以贴补收入的人

example.ex: I suggest supplementing your diet with vitamins E and A.
example.tran: 我建议你在日常饮食中补充些维生素 E 和维生素 A。

entry.def: A supplement is a pill that you take or a special kind of food that you eat in order to improve your health.

example.tran: 含复合维生素和矿物质的营养剂

example.ex: I took regular supplements and exercised every day.
example.tran: 我每天都按时吃营养片并坚持锻炼。

entry.def: A supplement is a separate part of a magazine or newspaper, often dealing with a particular topic.

example.ex: ...a special supplement to a monthly financial magazine.
example.tran: 一本金融杂志月刊的特别增刊

entry.def: A supplement to a book is an additional section, written some time after the main text and published either at the end of the book or separately.
A supplement is an extra amount of money that you pay in order to obtain special facilities or services, for example when you are travelling or staying at a hotel.

example.ex: If you are travelling alone, the single room supplement is £11 a night.
example.tran: 如果是一个人旅行，住单间每晚要多交 11 英镑。

entry.def: A supplement is an extra amount of money that is paid to someone, in addition to their normal pension or income.

example.ex: Some people may be entitled to a housing benefit supplement.
example.tran: 有些人可能有资格拿到住房补贴。

example.ex: ...people who need a supplement to their basic pension.
example.tran: 除了基本养老金外还需要额外补贴的人

means.word_mean: 1. textual matter that is added onto a publication; usually at the end
2. a quantity added (e.g. to make up for a deficiency)
3. a supplementary component that improves capability
1. add as a supplement to what seems insufficient;

sentences.sentence: "He appended a glossary to his novel where he used an invented language"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 补足物,船上的定员;补语
stems_affixes.word_buile: com全部+ple满,填满+ment表名词→全部满→补足
im使……+ple满,填满+ment物→[用来使……满]的工具,器具→贯彻,实现
sup下面+ple满,填满+ment表名词→下面填满→增补
com全部+ple满,填满+ment表名词→全部满→补足
im使……+ple满,填满+ment物→[用来使……满]的工具,器具→贯彻,实现

sentences.en: They had to get a job to supplement the family income.
sentences.cn: 他们不得不找一份工作以贴补家庭收入。

sentences.en: She supplements her diet with eggs and fruit.
sentences.cn: 她以鸡蛋和水果来补充饮食。

sentences.en: A supplement to this dictionary may be published next year.
sentences.cn: 该词典的补编或许将于明年出版。

jushi.english: They had to get a job to supplement the family income.
jushi.chinese: 他们不得不找一份工作以贴补家庭收入。
